abstract: Microsoft and Google are exploring new strategies to save money on their expensive, power-hungry data centers.
snippet: Microsoft and Google are exploring new strategies to save money on their expensive, power-hungry data centers.
lead_paragraph: Data centers can be such touchy things.

headline.main: In the New Data Center, It’s Roofs Off and Taxes Down

abstract: Tang Jun, the former Microsoft China chief executive officer and the only known Chinese victim in the Bernard L. Madoff scandal, has decided that Chinese private banks are a much safer place to invest his assets, China Daily reported.
snippet: Tang Jun, the former Microsoft China chief executive officer and the only known Chinese victim in the Bernard L. Madoff scandal, has decided that Chinese private banks are a much safer place to invest his assets, China Daily reported.
lead_paragraph: Tang Jun, the former chief executive of Microsoft China and the only known Chinese victim in the Bernard L. Madoff scandal, has decided that Chinese private banks are a much safer place to invest his assets, China Daily reported.

headline.main: Madoff’s Chinese Victim Returns to Private Banks

lead_paragraph: Brad Stone from our sister site Bits reports that EveryBlock.com, the two year-old experiment in hyperlocal news, is being bought by MSNBC.com, a joint venture between NBC and Microsoft. EveryBlock.com, a start-up based in Chicago, has been working to publish data feeds from governments in 15 American cities, including San Francisco, New York and Atlanta, and has been seen as a model for local coverage with information like police reports, building permits and restaurant inspections.

abstract: For the second month in a row, Bing gains in market share, as Google and Yahoo slip.
snippet: For the second month in a row, Bing gains in market share, as Google and Yahoo slip.
lead_paragraph: It may be far too early to pop the champagne on the Microsoft campus, but a celebration with a round of beers — the good stuff — may be in order.
